intro: Pentacalia napoensis, commonly known as the Napo penta, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It produces small, white or pale blue flowers that bloom in clusters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
